ai.summary: Mire Loch Loop is a short, easy 2.2 km circuit around a tranquil loch in the UK. Designed for casual walkers and families, the route follows flat, well-maintained paths with scenic water views and opportunities to observe local wildlife.
ai.terrain_summary: Mostly flat, surfaced paths around the loch; some muddy sections after rain; occasional boardwalks and compact gravel; damp ground near the water is common.
ai.safety_notes: - Check weather and daylight before starting; conditions can change near water. - Wear waterproof footwear and extra layers. - Stay on marked paths; watch for slippery boards and boggy ground after rain. - Keep children and pets under close supervision. - Carry a charged phone and basic navigation; know your limits and turn back if visibility worsens.
recommended_gear: Sturdy waterproof walking shoes or boots
Map, compass or offline map on your phone
Hat and sunscreen (summer); warm layer for cooler days
Rainproof cover or dry bag for electronics
ai.best_seasons: Spring through autumn (April–October); can be muddy and chilly in winter
